snippet: Vows made by President François Hollande to spur economic growth and shrink a budget deficit in France have clashed as an iconic carmaker prepares to lay off thousands of workers.
abstract: Trouble at iconic French auto company Peugeot is presenting President Francois Hollande, France's first Socialist leader since 1995, with an early, telling crisis that displays the contradictions at the heart of his campaign promises to spur economic growth while shrinking a budget deficit; Peugeot has announced plans to cut spending by $1.85 billion, lay off 8,000 workers and shut a major factory near Paris; Pres Holland says the plan is unacceptable, but it is unclear what, if anything, he can do to stop it.

byline.contributor: Elvire Camus contributed research from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Vows made by President François Hollande to spur economic growth and shrink a budget deficit in France have clashed as an iconic carmaker prepares to lay off thousands of workers.

headline.seo: Peugeot’s Troubles Test François Hollande’s Contradictory Campaign Promises
headline.main: In Peugeot’s Troubles, a Test of Contradictory Campaign Promises for Hollande
headline.print_headline: Peugeot’s Troubles Expose Contradictions in Hollande’s Campaign Promises
